org.cougaar.core.wp.resolver
Class Lease

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.core.wp.resolver.Lease
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class Lease
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

A "successful lease" response from the ClientTransport's ModifyService, indicating to the LeaseManager that either a new Record was successfully bound or an existing Lease was extended.

The LeaseManager client must renew this lease before it expires, otherwise the server(s) will automatically remove it.

Renewals can pass the UID of the Record, as documented in the ModifyService.

A relative "TTD" for the expiration data is also specified, which is relative to the base time passed by the "modifyAnswer" method.

See Also:

Method Detail

getUID

public UID getUID()
The UID of the lease, as selected by the View.

This is the "in response to" field.

getTTD

public long getTTD()
The lease time-to-death relative to the base timestamp.

This is the lease expiration date. A negative number indicates a failed bind or renewal, in which case the result field will be non-null.
